data.title: commands.icon contribution point is not clear
data.body:
According to the intellisense, it looks like it's possible to specify an `icon` as part of command properties.

However, it looks like it is not documented in VSCode website and I am not able to understand where is this displayed. I tried with bot `.png` and `.ico`, but I wasn't able to see anything.

Are there some restrictions? Am I doing something wrong?

data.title: Unify colors of find in file and workspace search results
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (4656fe3ff2952e9538d81e7a7571674352e5d62f, 2016-07-29T05:03:52.605Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Find in file (Ctrl+F) and workspace search (Ctrl+Shift+F) results are colored not exactly the same. It might be easier to read the color-coding if it was the same.

Local search:
![localsearch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/17222691/73127592-54ae-11e6-997a-5d221ff45a76.png)

Global search:
![globalsearch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/17222721/9a54f7a6-54ae-11e6-90e4-e58d88a44396.png)

Note the different browns for the results and the different renderings of the current line in the two cases.

(Extracted from #6402.)

data.title: TS Duplicate Identifier bug
data.body:
If you have typescript files opened up in your editor and make a new file and import something that was imported into any of the opened files into that new file, then save it as <anything>.ts, it will show a duplicate identifier error. You would expect it to not show anything since it's a new file without a duplicate identifier. This bug is only when other files are open.
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:31:10.994Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add a typescript file and import anything into it and save.
2. Keep that file open in your editor
3. Create a new file and import that same thing you imported in Step 1 then save it as a typescript file
4. Note the error on the import that vscode shows

data.title: Some strings not translated in latest vscode
data.body:
I know that not every release has to be fully localized but it seems like in the latest vscode insiders due to files moving around some strings are not translated which have previously been translated. For example:
- Explorer title
- Open Editors and the titles inside
- Extensions title and extensions input box placeholder

![screen shot 2016-07-29 at 16 53 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/17252450/0b5af064-55ad-11e6-9c09-200fe954d19e.png)

data.title: Make sure GITHUB_TOKEN is only used for GitHub URL
data.body:
1.4.0-insiders

vscode-extension-vscode/lib/shared.ts sets the Auth header for all URLs when GITHUB_TOKEN is set, should only be set for GitHub's URLs to avoid passing it to other parties.

(Found verifying #8834.)

data.title: Kinda Buggy Extension Manager
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

The New Grafical Extension Manager works great and looks great.
But there is a big downside. It uses the same Panel and even worse the same Panel width as the other Tools like Search, Debugger, Filebrowser and Git Manager.

It would be better if one could set the panel width per Tool or just a different one for the Extension Manager

Or another way i could think of would be if one could chose to open the Extension Manager in a separate Window instead.

data.title: Drag n drop of file into explorer not working
data.body:
1. Linux, vscode - latest insiders
2. Drop a file into explorer
3. File does not get copied over

If I drag the file over to the editor it is nicely opened. Dragging a folder also works.

I also verified and this all works on OS X, I just can not seem to get it to work on linux.

data.title: Debug: Allow click to show getter property value
data.body:
When I use chrome debugger, I find variables can't show the getter property value.  The PR to resolve the problem.

Before:
![qq 20160729214752](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7069719/17250850/c9c741da-55d8-11e6-888e-e3a1ce5d8672.png)

After:
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7069719/17250870/d9d15458-55d8-11e6-9fe2-6986c7a6ccfe.gif)
## How to implemented

Add a protocal command called `getVariable` to `DebugProtocol`. the command can get the variable`s value. See:
https://github.com/f111fei/vscode/blob/70007f9c238c89c5a3e8508b3ed8359f164312d5/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugProtocol.d.ts#L541

Add a property called `unsolved` to `DebugProtocol.Variable` .  If `unsolved` is true, the variable need use `getVariable` function to get correct value. See:
https://github.com/f111fei/vscode/blob/70007f9c238c89c5a3e8508b3ed8359f164312d5/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugProtocol.d.ts#L957

When click the unsolved variable, the `debugService.getVariable` to update the variable and render.

Last, implement the `getVariable` command in `vscode-chrome-debug-core`. I push the PR about the implement, See: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug-core/pull/75

Moreover, we need to update `debugProtocol.d.ts`. See:  https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/pull/49

data.title: editor is changing files when there is no activity

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:31:10.994Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:

I realized that the editor is changing files when there is no activity. I run my Node.js code in development using the `nodemon --exec` command. Sometimes this command restarts after ~10sec (repeatedly) but no changes are made (only the editor is opened, no clicking, writing). When I close the editor the process stop restarting.

data.title: Annoying "Do you want to save the changes?" messages.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.3.1
- OS Version:
  Linux (64bit)

Steps to Reproduce:
0. close all editors,
set:
1. "workbench.editor.showTabs": false,
2. { "key": "ctrl+w", "command": "workbench.action.closeEditorsInGroup" }
3. open an existing file 
4. press ctrl+2
5. open it again in the 2-nd editor and make some changes,
1. press ctrl+w.

Before the tabs feature come there were no annoying messages like "Do you want to save the changes..."?

I still have editor 1 with that file opened, I am not closing the file, **just 2nd editor (with one command)**. How to get rid of that message?

data.title: Errors not clearing after typing / building.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Mac OSX 10.11.5

Error not disappearing after save or typing. Initially I had a method `get` on the side.  I just left the options object as public and changed it.  I tried to clear the error by typing but it seems random parts of separate buffers are getting updated out of sync?

![screen shot 2016-07-29 at 14 08 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1652187/17249069/15aab8cc-5596-11e6-90d8-3de4ea90b5d8.png)

data.title: [css] Variable proposals in CSS are not shown or are not showing correct variables
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 (4656fe3ff2952e9538d81e7a7571674352e5d62f)
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
- Create a CSS file with following data

``` css
a {
  color:  
}

:root {
  --bg-color: red;
}
```
- after `color:` use intelli-sense

Expected: Variable --bg-color is part of suggestions
Observed: Variable is not part of suggestions

Also
- Move the `:root` selector to above rule `a`
- Now, variable is part of the suggestions
- Change the variable name to `--main-bg-color`

Expected: New variable name should be shown in suggestions
Observed: Old variable name is shown in suggestions

data.title: Scrollbar slider difficult to see in dark themes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

I'm colour blind (red/green, the most common type), and when using any dark theme I really struggle to see the scrollbar slider - there's just not enough contrast.

It would be helpful if themes were able to control the scrollbar colours. It would also be helpful if the scrollbar width could be increased (ideally themeable).

![Scrollbar](http://i.imgur.com/rojaTk6.png)

data.title: intellisense keeps rebuilding references Unity C#
data.body:
![intelli](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5999766/17244794/9e4981c2-55be-11e6-9274-f3cd1ec91c99.gif)
- VSCode Version: Version 1.3.1 (1.3.1)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install VSCode
2. write in a Unity C# project

As you type, suddenly intellisense is lost and all the references & auto complete are gone, then a few seconds later they come back. Coding like this is very frustrating as everything moves up and down all the time.

data.title: Debugger evaluates `this` wrong after using call on an arrow function
Increase rule stack protection limit - Syntax highlighting broken in JS files with multiple nested functions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider (anything after the 1.3.x builds, still broken as of the 2016-07-29 build)
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
Write some code and continue nesting functions until the syntax highlighting stops working.  Once it stops working then it will be broken for the remainder of the file.  Two examples are pasted below (obviously the examples are simplified and contrived, but they illustrate the problem):

![broken_highlight1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/430481/17240422/73544202-5539-11e6-866f-b48c7e3ce115.png)

![broken_highlight2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/430481/17240433/7e6e46b0-5539-11e6-92e9-7b5bcf4e7237.png)

data.title: Filename and Folder name conflict
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create file named "Parsers" using the New File popup menu command. (Note-this was a mistake and it was meant to be a folder.)
2. Delete file using popup menu command Delete. At this point, the parsers editor is still open and active even after I delete the file.
3. Create the proper folder named "Parsers" and add some files to it.
4. At this point, it is impossible to close the open parsers editor. The system will not let me do a save all and I was forced to reboot to get the system working properly again.

Note - I would suggest the proper action would be to close the associated editor when you delete a file.

data.title: Unable to reveal to the explorer by pressing hotkey(ctrl+shift+e) when explorer.autoReveal is false
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add the user setting "explorer.autoReveal": false
2. Pressing hotkey(ctrl+shift+e) to try to reveal the current active editor file in the explorer.

explorer.autoReveal shall be a control to allow auto reveal the opened (focused) file in the explorer panel, andit shall be allow user to reveal the current active file manually even when the the setting "explorer.autoReveal" is false.

data.title: Problem modifying files on a directory mounted to a Docker container
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Debian 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Start a docker container with a host's directory mounted onto the container's work directory (using the `-v` parameter).
2.  Make changes to a file ( e.g. `index.html`)
3. Refresh your browser and you shouldn't see the changes.

The thing is that if I edit the HTML file with vim (and `noswapfile` enabled), the changes are made and shown on the container. [I found this issue on docker's Github](https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/15793) that links this problem with the way text editors implement 'atomic saves', and some people suggest how to disable this behaviour on vim and Sublime Text 3. 
I couldn't find anything like that on the settings for VSCode. Is there something related to look at?
Thank you!

data.title: Decimal property is not displayed correctly in Variables in debugger
vscode-languageserver-types repo/license doesn't exist
data.body:
While running OSS tool I hit this:

```
ERROR: vscode-languageserver-types@1.0.1: No license detail found at repositoryURL: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-types-node
```

The repo https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-types-node (or https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-types) seems to not exist, though I'd linked to from other repositories and npm packages.

data.title: Condition of breakpoint on first line not evaluated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (531a56f772fc33ec88910328b88f4dbd7ae5df43, 2016-07-28T16:55:53.763Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Place a conditional breakpoint on the first line (entry point), e.g.: console.log('hit')
2. Start debugging
3. Unexpected: Debugger stops without output in the console

This works as expected when the breakpoint is on the second line.

Found verifying #9174.
